Clinical Encounters.table_description: This table is a consolidated record of patient-clinician interactions, encapsulating a variety of clinical visits ranging from regular check-ups to specialized procedures. The data captured here reflects not only the nature and status of each encounter but also offers insights into the professional details of the involved healthcare providers. By highlighting the context and specifics of each encounter, this table serves as a vital tool in understanding patient flow, clinician specialties, and the general operational dynamics of healthcare facilities.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

CaseType.description: Classification of a case. For transplant pts, case type helps identify the type of transplant.

FacilityCode.description: The physical campus of the unit associated with a detail transaction.

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

PCPCredential.description: The primary credential or medical degree of a primary care provider.

PCPSpecialty.description: The primary credentialed specialty of a patient's current primary care provider.

ServiceTimeStamp.description: Date/time the service was provided at this location.

VisitStatus.description: The pending, arrived, cancelled, bumped, rescheduled or no show status of an appointment/visit.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

Demographics.table_description: The Pt Demographics table provides critical data about the personal, ethnic, and sociocultural background of patients. Such information is invaluable for delivering culturally competent care and understanding the diverse patient population that the healthcare facility caters to. The table also contains data about patient mortality, aiding in the sensitive management of patient records and communications.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

AgeAtEncounter.description: The age of the patient at the time of the encounter_ts.

InsuranceType.description: Primary type of insurance patient has.

EthnicGroup.description: Classification of a patient's ethnic background as Hispanic, non- Hispanic or Unknown. Source: eHR and Patient Registration; converted to SON Minimum Data Fields.

Gender.description: A patient's sex (converted to SON Minimum Data Fields).

Language.description: The language spoken by a patient. Recorded on hospital admission. Source: eHR and Patient Registration.

Race.description: A patient's self-reported race. Examples: Black, White, unknown Hispanic origin should be recorded in Ethnicity field. Converted to SON Minimum Data Fields.
values: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

ZipCode3Digit.description: The first 3 digits of a patient's zip code of residence, entered in the registration process.

MaritalStatus.description: A patient's marital status as captured in the patient registration. Converted to SON Minimum Data Fields.

PatientExpiredIndex.description: Indicators that indicate a patient is known to be dead. "1" indicates "dead".

Diagnosis.table_description: The Diagnosis table forms the cornerstone of clinical documentation, cataloging the health conditions and diseases identified during patient encounters. By systematically documenting both ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes, this table facilitates continuity of care, aids in medical billing, and ensures standardized tracking of diseases and health conditions. Additionally, the table provides crucial insights into the context, location, and ranking of each diagnosis, making it instrumental for holistic patient care, research, and healthcare analytics.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

DiagnosisEventSequence.description: The sequence that diagnoses are made; Unique identifier for a record.

DiagnosisRanking.description: An indication of whether a diagnosis was considered primary or secondary. NOTE: 1. each source system of diagnosis may have its own determination of primary or secondary 2. This is only found for Billing Diagnosis records.

DiagnosisScope.description: The context in which a diagnosis was attached to an event or encounter. Usually, an indication of the type of system that posted the diagnosis.

ICD10Code.description: An ICD-10 diagnosis that justifies or results from a given encounter or clinical event.

ICD9Code.description: An ICD-9 diagnosis that justifies or results from a given encounter or clinical event.

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

ServiceTimeStamp.description: The day service was rendered at a healthcare facility. Has these purposes: 1. The day of service posted to any billing transaction. 2. The day of a clinical event captured in an eHR. 3. The census day in hospital census reporting. 4. The day a scheduling transaction is logged.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

Hospital Encounter.table_description: The Hospital Encounters table provides a comprehensive view of a patient's journey through a healthcare facility, from admission to discharge. It collates a rich set of data points including the reasons for the visit, the specialists attending, the length of the stay, the eventual discharge disposition, and many other pivotal facets. This table not only elucidates clinical and administrative perspectives but also is instrumental for billing, operations, and quality control.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

AdmissionSource.description: The source of an admission, such as HMO, referral, transfer, etc. Each hospital assigns admission source values. Although there is general agreement between hospital on the common definitions, values diverge in some cases. Each value is tied to a univeral billing (UB82) value for admission source. The UB codes are consistent across all hosiptals.

AdmissionType.description: The circumstances under which a patient is admitted. Each hospital assigns admission type values. Although there is general agreement between hospital on the common definitions, values diverge in some cases. Each value is tied to a univeral billing (UB82) value for admission type. The UB codes are consistent across all hospitals.

AdmitPrimaryPosition.description: The primary position or job title of the admitting physician.

AdmitTimeStamp.description: Date/time of a patient's arrival to the hospital. Used to compute elapsed time from arrival to a given clinical event.

AdmittingCredential.description: The primary credential or medical degree of an admitting provider.

AdmittingSpecialty.description: The specialty -- as defined by the hospital -- of the admitting physician.

AttendingCredential.description: The credential of the attending physician of a hospital encounter. May also be called "discharging physician".

AttendingSpecialty.description: The specialty -- as defined by the hospital -- of the attending physician.

DaysSinceLastDischarge.description: The number of days between this encounter's admit_ts and the same patient's previous enconter's discharge time

DischargeTimeStamp.description: Date/time of a patient's discharge from the hospital.

DishargeDisposition.description: Disposition of the patient at discharge (e.g., left against medical advice, discharged home, expired). Code values are consistent across all hospitals. Each value is tied to a univeral billing (UB82) value for discharge disposition. The UB codes are consistent across all hospitals.

EncounterType.description: A general classification of the nature of the hospital encounter.

HospitalCode.description: The organizational entity admitting the patient.

LengthOfStay_days.description: Length of stay in days (and fraction of days). Calculated from admit_dt to discharge_dt.

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

MSDRGCaseMixIndex.description: Total DRG weights divided by the total number of encounters. Can be broken down by Patients, Organizations (Pavilion), Admission/Discharge Dates, Payer (Financial Class) and DRGs.

MSDRGCode.description: Medicare Severity-Diagnosis Related Group, a system of classifying a Medicare patient's hospital stay into various groups in order to facilitate payment of services.

PerformingCredential.description: The primary credential or medical degree of a provider performing a clinical event.

VisitCondition.description: A patient's general clinical condition in a hospital stay.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

Labs.table_description: The Labs table encompasses crucial details associated with laboratory tests and results during a patient's encounter in a healthcare facility. This table captures both the administrative and clinical aspects of laboratory testing, from specimen collection to test results verification. It aids healthcare professionals in making informed decisions based on the patient's lab results, ensuring accurate and effective treatment.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

DataType.description: A general classification of a discrete clinical result. It helps identify the type of result being reported. Often, it describes the database data type of a value.

LabResult.description: The discrete result of a lab test.

LabResultSequence.description: An identifier that uniquely identifies a lab record (primary key). These are in order by sequence of events for a particular encounter.

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

LOINCDesc.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes.

PerformingCredential.description: The primary credential or medical degree of a provider performing a clinical event.

ResultUnit.description: Units of measurement for the result.

ResultVerifyTS.description: Date/time that the result was finalized.

SpecimenCollectTS.description: Date/time that a lab specimen was collected.

SpecimenReceiveTS.description: Date/time that a lab specimen is collected

SpecimenType.description: A classification of a collected specimen.

StructuredResultType.description: The type of lab assay that was run.

VerifyingCredential.description: The credential of the person signing off on the lab result. (not present in many records)

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

Medication.table_description: This table captures comprehensive information about medications that are either prescribed or administered to patients in various healthcare settings. It integrates records from electronic health records (eHR) to provide specifics on the medication itself, the context in which it's given, its dosage, frequency, and related administrative details. Each entry includes pertinent details like the type of medication, its route of administration, the performing healthcare professional's credentials, and any related timestamps. This table is essential for ensuring patient safety, understanding medication-related clinical decisions, and auditing medication orders and administrations.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

Dosage.description: The dosage ordered, dispensed or administered on an eHR medication order; also dosage for prescribed mediations. Applies to inpatient medications written through a healthcare facility, as well as prescribed outpatient/clinical encounters.

DosageUnitCode.description: (Unit measure dosage) The unit measure specified for the dosage of a medication ordered in the eHR.

Frequency.description: The interval for which a medication is to be administered, as ordered in the eHR. Sample values: As needed, q12hr

IsAdmin.description: An Indicator as to whether the record is an administered medication or a prescribed medication. 1 indicates administered and 0 indicates prescribed.

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

PRNOrderYN.description: An indication of whether an order is a PRN order.

RouteMed.description: The route ordered for a given administered medication.

Year.description: Date/time that the result was finalized.

Microbiology.table_description: The Microbiology Labs table encompasses crucial details about tests executed in a microbiology laboratory. These tests aim to detect, identify, and characterize microorganisms present in collected specimens, which might be indicative of infections. The data contained within not only reflects the clinical specifics of the tests and their results but also highlights the context surrounding patient encounters, specimen collection, and eventual interpretation of results.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

LabPatientType.description: A classification of the type of encounter associated with a lab test.

MedicalSite.description: A body site or piece of medical equipment from which a specimen is collected.

SpecimenType.description: A classification of a collected specimen, such as blood or urine.

ResultInterpretation.description: A high-level description of a given result.

Assay.description: The test - or panel of tests - ordered. This is the equivalent of the eHR order_catalog.

PositiveCultureYN.description: A designation of a microbiology lab result as positive or negative.

Organism.description: A microorganism that may be detected in a microbiology lab culture.

SpecimenCollectTS.description: Date/time that a lab specimen was collected.

SpecimenReceiveTS.description: Date/time that a lab specimen was received.

ResultVerifyTS.description: Date/time that the result was finalized.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

Orders.table_description: The Orders table contains comprehensive data about clinical tasks that are directed by healthcare professionals in a clinical setting. This table ensures that every medical instruction, whether for medications, lab tests, radiology exams, or any other clinical activity, is meticulously documented. Such detailed data helps in understanding the clinical journey of patients, ensuring their safety, and analyzing patterns in medical practices.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

ClinicCategory.description: The clinically relevant grouping of an ordered item.

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

OrderItemType.description: A general classification of an eHR orderable. NOTE: Items with a "zz.." prefix are no longer used.

OrderStatus.description: The current progress of a clinical order.

OrderTS.description: Date/time that a clinical order was issued.

PRNIndYN.description: An indication of an eHR order as PRN (as needed).

SpecialtyPrimary.description: The primary credentialed specialty of a primary care physician. Source: Cactus, via eHR.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

AttendingCredential.description: The primary credential or medical degree of the attending provider performing a hospital event.

CPTCode.description: Clinical Procedure Terminology. A code defined by the American Medical Association identifying a medical service or procedure. The primary means of identifying services, CPTs are also used to bill outpatients at hospitals.

CPTDesc.description: Cant Find Description / associated field from old data dictionary

CPTType.description: The indication of whether the record is a clinical procedure or a hospital procedure.

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

PerformingCredential.description: The primary credential or medical degree of the provider performing a hospital event.

ProcCount.description: Total number of procedures for a given encounter (available for hospital encounters only).

ServiceTimeStamp.description: The day service was rendered at a healthcare facility. Has these purposes: 1. The day of service posted to any billing transaction. 2. The day of a clinical event captured in an eHR. 3. The census day in hospital census reporting. 4. The day a scheduling transaction is logged.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

Surgery.table_description: The Surgeries/Anesthesia table is a comprehensive record that provides a detailed overview of the surgical and anesthesia procedures undergone by patients. This information plays a significant role in understanding the surgical process, from the setup of the operating room to the cleanup, the surgical and anesthesia personnel involved, and the specifics of the anesthesia process. The meticulous documentation assists in the analysis of surgery durations, patient care under anesthesia, and ensures the highest standards of surgical and anesthesia practices.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

AnesDocType.description: The document type in which the intraoperative anesthesia data for the case was recorded. Useful for distinguishing cath lab cases from other anesthesia cases, and for distinguishing cases staffed by hospital-associated physicians.

AnesGroupType.description: All anesthesia types used in the case listed in a single record.

AnesType.description: Type of anesthesia administered during the case.

AntibioticGivenYN.description: The indication of whether antibiotics were given according to anesthesia personnel. A Yes does not necessarily mean that antibiotics were given in compliance with SCIP (within 60 minutes of the start of the procedure).

LocationType.description: Type of location where the procedure was rendered.

PatientInRoomTS.description: Date/time that the patient entered the operating room for the surgical case.

PatientOutRoomTS.description: Date/time that the patient exited the operating room.

PrimaryProcedure.description: The primary procedure performed during the surgical case.

PrimarySpecialty.description: The primary practice specialty assigned to an ordering provider by the institutional credentialing office.

PtInRoomDuration_min.description: Total minutes the patient was in the operating room.

RevenueSpecialty.description: The primary specialty assigned to a billing provider by Finance. Usually, this is a rollup of the practice specialty assigned by the Credentialing Office. Source: EeMR Revenue Specialty.

ServiceSection.description: The location of the case down to the operating room.

SurgDuration_min.description: Total minutes the patient was in surgery.

SurgicalSpecialty.description: The surgical specialty associated with the case.

SurgPersonnelRole.description: The role each person played in the case.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).

Susceptibility.table_description: The Micro Susceptibility Labs table is dedicated to capturing essential details related to microbiology susceptibility testing. Such tests are vital in determining the sensitivity or resistance of microorganisms to specific antibiotics. This aids clinicians in prescribing the most effective antibiotic treatment for an infection. The table emphasizes not only the clinical details of the tests and their results but also the contextual details surrounding the patient encounter and specimen collection.

EncounterID.description: A number that uniquely identifies a visit to a healthcare facility.

PatientID.description: An ID associated with a patient. All Patient_IDs have been anonymized.

Antibiotic.description: The antibiotic drug used in a sensitivity test at a microbiology lab.

AntibioticPanel.description: Predefined set of antibiotics used for a susceptibility test.

Assay.description: Name of the susceptibility test that was run.

MedicalSite.description: A body site or piece of medical equipment from which a specimen is collected

Organism.description: A microorganism that may be detected in a microbiology lab culture. Sample values: E Coli, Staph, Strep

ResultSusceptSeq.description: Unique identifier for susceptibility labs. NOTE: Sorting by this field will put all micro susceptibility labs for a particular encounter in sequential order.

ResultVerifyTS.description: Date/time that the result was finalized.

SpecimenCollectTS.description: Date/time that a lab specimen was collected.

SpecimenReceiveTS.description: Date/time that a lab specimen was received.

SusceptInterpretation.description: A high-level description of a given result.

Year.description: Year the service was rendered (shifted up to 365 days to maintain the anonymity of the patient).
